text: Semi hazy brown liquid, hardly any head. Strong aroma of smoked ham. Light body, little bit carbonation. Taste of smoked ham.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade.
Hazy ruby colored with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and smoke with notes of hops.
Fruity flavor of caramel, smoke and hops.
Smoked finish.

Orange amber clean robe. Few thin bubbles.
Nose of smoke caramel and herbs.
Light body.
Palate is a bit green-ish. Finish is quite smoked.
A bit light to my taste, but definitely a nice and easy to drink quite complex smoked beer.

Po odkapslowaniu bucha szynka, trochę karmelu, mało się dzieje, ale udane połączenie, taki karmelizowany boczek, może trochę chleba. W smaku bardziej dymnie, nadal szynkowo, ale wędzonka idzie bardziej w spaloną dechę, karmelu też sporo, ale i więcej pieczywa tu wychodzi. Dość słodko, wędzonka próbuje kontrować, ale mimo wszystko piwo jest dość jednowymiarowe, na pochwałę zasługuje jeszcze żytnia faktura.
Es una cerveza demasiado especiada, huele a pimentón y es casi como beberte chorizo liquido.
Bottle from Martins fairview. Pours clear chestnut brown with off white foam head. Aroma is burnt toast, smoky wood, salty smoke bacon. Flavour is a smoky sweet biscuit with a smooth ham finish.

Vierte ámbar oscuro con pequeña corona de espuma beige de buena retención; aromas a humo, caramelo, especias, flores y malta tostada; en boca entrada media, maltosa con ligero amargor que se acentúa en el retrogusto; cuerpo y carbónico medios, notas ahumadas, curiosa, compleja y equilibrada cerveza , resultando fácil de beber.

Aromas ahumados y fruta madura.
Buen aspecto, poca retencion de espuma.
En boca ahumada, caramelo y fruta madura, el final seco y amargo

330ml Bottle at home. Winner style (down to 5)
Poured dark amber to Chestnut colour with decent creamish head. Nose is smokey roasted ham and malt. Taste is roasted malts, char, caramel, smokey hops and wheat. Good.

Bottle at home, 25th February 17. Pours a chestnut brown, good fluffy head. Aroma is smoke, phenols, some roared malt. Taste is smoke, roasted malts, some sweetness, slight caramel. Different and enjoyable winter beer.
Bottle. Dark brown, small head. Aroma is quote aggressive smoked ham, after some time becomes more mellow. I didnt like it very much.

Kran. W smaku i aromacie dominuje przyjemna wędzonka, dym, oscypek, szynka, bardzo wyraźne. W wyglądzie brązowe, mętne, z przyzwoitą beżową pianą. Ciało dość ciężkie. Nieco brakuje charakteru sahti, ale piwo przyjemne i wyraziste

Pours a dark amber, with lacy froth. Nose is immense, loads of savoury smokiness, subtle bitter notes. Taste is very fine, bitter/sweet/smoky, with herbal green notes from the juniper. Palate is decent, but a tad watery in the finish. Overall superb
Dark cola brown. Slightly clear. Slightly bubbly beige head. Aroma is nice and smoky with a bit of bread. Taste starts with a lot of smoked meat and rye and finishes with a tart gin and tonic taste.

Ciemno bursztynowe, klarowne. Piana bezowa, drobna, opada ze śladami na szkle. 
W aromacie wyraźnie wędzone, nuty dębowe. Pod nimi gorzki karmel. 
W smaku wędzonka, ale mocno wymieszana ze słodkimi akcentami. Bardzo przyjemnie smakuje. Rzeczywiście jest przyjemna nuta jałowca. 
Sporo ciała, lekko zakleja usta. 
Nie jest mocno wysycone, przyjemnie się pije. 
Bardzo fajne piwo.

Keg Third of a Pint at BrewDog, Camden, London in Jan 2016 - Dark Reddish Brown in colour. Good creamy off-white head. Excellent lacing. Very Malty; smoked malts, grainy rye malts, bonfire, ash, caramel. Spicy. Fruity; mild fruitiness. Sweet smoky rye malty and spicy throughout. Dry smoky finish. Quite salty. Good smoke. Unusual but interesting beer. Liked this. Decent. (2016-01-27)

Bottle 0.33l at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Colour is clear light copper with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Grain, some bread, smoke, caramel, some tar and malts. This is not sahti. Admins please change style to smoked/specialty grain. Still pretty good.

33 cl. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: intense and nice aromas of smoked cereals.
Appearance: deep amber-copper color with above average head thickness. Off-white foam with under average retention. Clear beer. Medium Brussels lacing. Very good appearance.
Taste: medium sweetness, low bitterness, low sourness. Some salty overtones. Nice flavors of smoked cereals. The smoked flavor hides all the other flavors, but its a very nice smoked flavor reminding of barbecue, smoked salmon, smoked cheeses like the great italian scamorza cheese, smoked pork, bacon, etc.
Palate: medium body, oily texture, low carbonation, very long bittersweet finish of smoked cereals. 
Overall: nice and different beer. Very good appearance, and intense aromas and flavors of smoked cereals. Very different but very good and drinkable. Im very surprised by this beer. Ill drink it again for sure. One of the best smoked beers ive ever tasted. Really good stuff here.

Butelka 330ml. Kolor bursztynowy, mętnawy od drobinek osadu, piana średnia ale ujdzie. Aromat śliwki wędzonej dominuje nad wszystkim innym, jak w kompocie wigilijnym, smak torfowy z ziołami i wędzonka , wędzonka, wędzonka. Chyba najlepsze red rye jaki spożyłem, bardzo dobre piwo.

Pours deep copper, clear, almost no head, only very tiny layer. Rather strong aroma of smoked cheese, some maltiness and caramel, also some dried plums. Very delicate taste, rather sweet and malty, some bitterness, surprisingly almost no smoke in taste. LIght body, short finish. Could easily serve as an entrance to smoked beers, quite drinkable, but I expected more overall.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Nice smoke over chocolate and spiciness. Sticky mouthfeel. Very tasty
15/20 probably the nicest smoked beer Ive ever had. Smoked but not overpowering and beer tastes good. Wanted another after I finished the bottle.

33cl bb June 17, many thanks idiosynkrasie for this tasty approximation of a recently missing style. - Bref: smoked red rye ale adds boughy, fresh beechwood smoke to berry-like hops. Not sure how this qualifies as a sahti, nor does it seem intended to be by the brewer? Somehow a crosscut of Schlenkerla Märzen, Uerige Alt and a light ESB: subtle, Alt-dry use of juniper that works well with the smoke and hops. Smooth, consummate composition made for a Scottish session it seems...

Bottle from Saveur-Biere as Red Rye. Pours dark red/brown with a light tan head. Aroma of strong smoked cheese, malt, chocolate, subtle hop and spices. Light sweetness and bitterness with a touch of sour and a little salty too. Light/medium body, thin yet sticky texture, average carbonation. Finish has a smokey bitter edge.

No to mamy tu w tej malej buteleczce zamknieta cala Frankonie. Bardzo zblizone zapachem jak i smakiem do wedzonek z Bamberga zwlaszcza. Zapach dymu, torfu, ziola suszone nad ogniskiem. W smaku kielbasa jalowcowa, aronia, troche jerzyny i ta caly czas wedzonka, becon w ustach jakby pozostal i utknal w gardle. Super. Wyglad to lekko drobinkowo metne ciemno czerwone piwo z niewielka pianka na 2cm opadajaca szybko.

Smoked Malts Rules Everything Around Me... clear bright red/brown, with a fine light brown head.. Aroma of smoked malts, bacon, some smoked pig, Taste of malts, smoked, medium sweetness, weak bitterness, soft, bacon, slightly iron, rye, tasty, medium body, low co2....
amber brown; clear, medium off-white foam; smoky meat, caramel, some fruits; medium bitterness and sweetness; moderately thick, medium body, average- carbonation, long bittersweet finish
Fajna, herbatnikowo-karmelowa słodowość, sporo przyjemnego, ogniskowego dymu. Dobre.

Bottle
Aroma-smoke, spices
Appearance-red, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

butelka/strefa piwa. ciemnobrązowe z początkowo dużą, grubopęcherzykową pianą redukującą się do zera. w aromacie wędzonka z oscypka, po ogrzaniu karmel, toffi, słodowość, drewienko, ale główną nutą jest wciąż wędzonka. w smaku początkowo słodycz, ale z wyraźną wytrawną nutą. raczej szybko znika z podniebienia.

Im partial to a smokey beer, and this surprised me. 
Pours a nice amber colour with a cream coloured head. Nice smokey aroma, earthy background. Thick texture and an average carbonation. Nice, short finish.

5.4%ABV. Red Rye Ale.

Poured out cloudy Amber Brown. 20ºSRM.

Nose is immediately redolent with wood smoke and wood with cherry, oak and maybe some bourbon. There is the sweetness of young wet pine. Nose is overall very sweet and agreeable.

Mouthfeel is light soap. Palate has some rounded fullness in the beginning suggesting a light sour and minerality. Palate also is reminiscent of longan and red date tea with the depth of dried longans and the light sweetness of dried red dates. There are of course charcoal, burnt tiwigs, burnt matchsticks, charred bourbon in the smoky compartment of the palate. Hops are resin, sap and richly bitter, like noble hops but without the freshness of pine or citrus. Just right for this brew which is angling for the darker, smokier end of the palate rather than the fresher, citrusy end.

Finish is medium with woodsmoke for me.

Goes on Favorites List!

Red, minimal head. Aroma: beech smoke, bit of caramel. Light body, quite dry, medium to low bitterness. Again smokyness in flavour, quite clean profile, maybe some fruity notes, bit spicy from rye. Bit earthy and woody at finish. Not much happening.

330ml bottle [as Unforgiven Red Rye]. Minimally cloudy, dark amber colour with small, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Smoky, spicy aroma, notes of ham, smoked eel, oak ashes, a touch of juniper, caramel. Taste is dry, smoky, spicy, slightly grassy hoppy, hints of huniper, coniferes, oak ashes, cautious rye spiciness, a touch of caramel; slightly mineral, chalky, leafy, bitter finish. Well balanced, slightly light and minimally watery. Very nice.

Rood koperkleurig bier met snelzakkende beige schuimkraag.
Aroma: intense rookgeur met accenten van gerookte ham en brandend vuur.
Smaak: sterk gerookte mouten met lichtzoete karameltoets. 
Gemiddeld mondgevoel met licht koolzuur en kruidige afdronk.

IBU:  25 
 Kolor:  Ciemnomiedziany z wyraźnymi czerwonymi przebłyskami. Piwo jest ładnie oplizujące. 
 Piana:  Wysokich rozmiarów kupa żółtego puchu. Piana określony czas wisi na powierzchni. Kiedy już znudzi jej się obserwacja otoczenia, pęka do smukłego łańcuszka. Wstążki na ściankach ładnie zarysowane.
Pod koniec degustacji na dnie pozostaje tylko lekki kożuszek. 
 Zapach:  Intensywna wędzona nuta, chwilami nawet na poziomie Schlenkerla Rauchbier.
Zdecydowane akcenty wędzonej szynki, boczku, a w tle nuty ogniska.
Tuż za nimi nuty zbożowe, żytnia pikantności i odrobina przypieczonego chleba. 
 Smak:  W smaku potężna doza wędzonych słodów. Wyraźna boczkowo-szynkowa wędzonka. 
W tle nuty pieczonego chleba ze szczyptą karmelu.
Jałowiec jest także mocno wyeksponowany. 
Zaraz za nim jest szczypta czerwonych, kwaskowatych owoców. Piwo chwilami przybiera kwaśnych, a potem i słonych posmaków.
Drewnianie detale dają się poznać na koniec degustacji.
Goryczka średniego kalibru. Mocny korzenny, ściągający finisz. 
Piwo raz po raz jest słone, a raz kwaśne.
Ciekawy kontrast.
Unforgiven jest średniopełne i ma dość gęstą teksturę.
Pijalność umiarkowana. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumownie:  

Dość specyficzne piwo ze względu na brak jednoznacznej przynależności do konkretnego stylu.
Niby Sahti, niby Rauch, niby Rye Ale czy Red Ale. Wszystkiego po trochu.
Na pewno na uwagę zasługuje aromat, któremu bliżej do bamberowskich Schlenkerla Rauchbiers.
Jest mocno wędzony z akcentami wędzonki szynkowo-boczkowej uzupełnionej o dym z ogniska.
Smak ma dodatkowo jeszcze wyraźną nutę jałowca.
Posmaki gorzkie mieszają się ze słonymi, a te nawet z kwaśnymi. Oryginalny misz-masz.
Dość intrygująco, ale mnie aż tak bardzo nie porwało.
Owszem pijalne, ale w połączeniu tych wszystkich składowych wychodzi lekki chaos.
Piwo z pewnością nie dla każdego.

Bottle. Sensoric. Reddish with small to medium, light brown head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is smokey with hints of dried red fruits, slightly wooden notes, ashy. Taste is mild, light roasted malts, some sweet brown sugar. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is lightly bitter and semi-dry. In Its hard to summarize, on the one hand you can say nice, smokey, nicely drinkable beer, but on the other nothing special and outstanding. You choose.

Tasted from the tap on the Hanging Bat (11/08/2016). Amber to copper colour with a thin tan head. Aroma of malts, smoked wood, smoked salmon and some caramel. Taste is smoked salmon, ¿honey?, some caramel and wood. Next one please!

Smells great. Smoked ham and barbecue. Pours clear sherry cask whisky red. A bit thin for the big flavours of smoke, red fruit and malt. Ramp up the abv and this would be awesome. Its a seriously drinkable smoked beer though.
Leicht trübes kupferrot mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, reichlich rauchig, Schinken, letwas süßlich, leicht fruchtig, dunkle Beeren, süffig.

330 ml as "Unforgiven Red Rye" bb 08 Feb 17. Shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Copper-brownish body, with a small, creamy, a bit lacing, beige head.
Aroma of smoked wood, bacon, caramel, some spices, some toast, dark fruits.
Tastes of smoke, wood, toast, caramel, black tea, some spices, some dark fruits.
Medium, quite creamy mouthfeel, with
Finishes smokey, dry, wooden, a bit roasty-bitter, toasty, with subtle sweet malts and fruits.

Very nice. Aromatic, characterful and although pretty smokey, still well balanced, with enough sweet malt body. Not sure about the category, tastes like a classic smoked beer in the Bamberg style to me. Enjoyable stuff, if you like smoke-forward beers.

0,33l bottle at home shared with Saeglopur. BB 08.02.2017. As "Tempest Unforgiven Red Rye". brown / redish lightly hazy color, small white head. smells rather smokey, spices, bacon, light charcoal, hints of peat, nice smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of ash, some peat, earthy, some smoke, some dark fruits, light sherry, some grass towards the finish. finishes earthy & also grassy bitter with notes of charcoal, dark fruits and some smoke. very good one. very enjoyable beer.

Small beige head. Deep dark red body with barely visible floaties. Smoky dried red fruits aroma with candy notes. Bitter-sweet smoky fruity taste with wooden notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfee. Dryish-astringent fruity smoky aftertaste with chocolatey caramel notes. Nice, but the persistent bitter/astringent back note is disturbing. If they could mute that a bit this would get a higher score. (0.33l bottle, from some odd bins in Edinburgh. Oh, and by the way, this has NOTHING to do with sahti, or gotlandsdricka, or koduõlu.)

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy ruby with a small off-white head. Aroma of smoke, wood, juniper and caramel notes. Sweet flavor, with umami, that ends up more dry with some bitterness, medium bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation. A nice Sahti. 🌟🌟🌟

A dark red beer, a head is small and beige. Aroma has tar liquirice and smoke, great. Taste has smoke, some tar liquirice and roastiness, balanced sweetness, some bitterness, hint of juniper. Medium bodied. Tasteful and tar liquirice beer.
bottle bb 8/2/17 ramato carico quasi limpida piacevoli note affumicate buona beva piuttosto morbida

Slightly hazy dark red color with tan head. Aroma is really smokey with the rauchbier type of smoked malts, savory, resembling smoked meat. Taste starts somehow astringent, smokey, then you get some spicy rye malt and finishes quite bitter and earthy. Medium body with smooth mouthfeel. A very interesting style of beer. The combination of rauch-malts and spicy rye works quite well.

Bottle from Bishops Cave as Unforgiven Red Rye. Brownish red with a thin ring of sandalwood head around the glass. The ginny tart sweetness of juniper is overridden by intense maple smoked bacon and forest floor. Sweet-savoury taste from the smokiness with an underlying tenacious hop bitterness. Bodys surprisingly thin considering the complexity of the flavours. If this is what sahtis all about then Im booking the first flight to Finland.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 As Unforgiven Red Rye. Irregular, moussy, pale greyish white, lacing head over a near clear beautiful copper red coloured beer with even a ruby hue to it. Aroma of smoked herring, juniper berries and even juniper leaves, cured bacon, toast, caramel, dried shrimp, smoldering peat and even iodine, dried cranberry, red apple peel, even some faint peach, raw beetroot, hazelnut. Crisp, refreshing onset, clean fruitiness, dried red berries, red apple and faint orange, sweetish mixed with sourish, softish carbo, smoked meat flavor immediately lending umami-like flavors and lying on top of caramelly malt sweetishness with a throughly nutty bittering edge to it; finishes in some resinous spiciness (juniper berry?), even a kind of raw vegetable-like quality, retronasal smokiness and lingering caramelly maltiness, with an earthy, gently bittering hop character added.  In view of the smoky character and its classification here, I guess this is intended as a Gotlandsdricka, a type of ancient Swedish home brew, often a rye beer, with jupiner added and allegedly having a smoky character.  Allegedly, since I have not had one so far, but it would surprise me if this one would be a truly convincing example of this all but forgotten style.  Comes across more like a spiced Rauchbier if you ask me, but whatever it is, it is enjoyable enough, perhaps a bit on the thin side, but certainly interesting.

Smokey, sweet bread, spiced, juniper berrie, earthy. Nice body, especially given the low carbonation and low abv. Well balanced spice but a good smokey aroma wins me over in the end. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear brown amber beer with small carbonation and small ivory white foam. Smell: superb caramel malt notes. Sweet brown sugar balanced with grassy hops. Taste: medium body with caramel malt presence good balanced with grassy hops. Superb attenuation and really easy drinkable. Aftertaste: grassy and sweet caramel notes. Bread notes. Wet bitterness.

330ml bottle from Saveur Biére - Rating 1857 for Jamesie1857 completes beer styles for me, thought it was apt. Ruby red body, a bit hazy, Nose is heavy smoke, quite addictive, bacon, bbq, heavy. Taste similar, a bit of a smokefest, dry finish. Nice style to finish the styles off.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2016 Dark ruby with a very very thin beige head. Smells like wood smoke, bacon, smoked sausages. The taste is dominated by the same notes, made a bit more mild by the rye bread and roasted walnuts notes.

Bottle thanks to Joe! Pours clear reddish hazel, medium tan head, dissipates pretty quickly, decent lacing. Aroma is smoky, grass, caramel. Flavor is light plus sweet, light plus bitter, medium smoked malt, hardwood fires, juniper twigs. Medium body. Pretty tasty beer, actually.

On tap at OX184, Edinburgh, june 15th 2015. Dark amber body, small tanned head. Aroma is herbal with forest and smoke, taste is spicy, peated, light sweetness. Ash and caramel, soft bitterness with a sweet caramel smoke aftertaste. Pretty damn nice.

Keg at OX184, Edinburgh, Friday 18th March 2016 in the company of Dad and Barry.  Pours reddy amber in colour with an off-white head, jolly good clarity. Malt dominated nose, malty information the mouth, sweet fruits, a dab of caramel on the nose and in the mouth. Soft in the mouth.  A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13 3.3

Bottle from Taps Beer Bar, Changkat, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a clear reddish amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is smokey bacon malt. The flavour is moderate bitter with a smooth light woody hop, smoky, light fruit, light creamy yeast palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Strange and interesting but not for me oak tcp twigs reminds me of lapsong sousong pours glowing Amber with yellow tinged head

Aroma and taste is malt forward with some smoked prominence, meaty, light char, rye, some smoke into the finish.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, España.
A: Hazy amber / Ambar turbio.
T/S: Malt, smoked bacon, slightly citrusy / Malta, bacon ahumado, ligeramente citrico.
Pours a dark red with a cream head. Aroma is heavy smoked malts. Flavour is again, heavy smoked with an almost meaty taste. Not one for me.

Appearance: clear ryby red with light beige head.
Aroma: hops and smoked malt.
Taste: smoked, medium bitter.
Palate: smooth, medium body, medium carbonation.
Overall: nice.
Clear copper, off-white lacing foam head. NIce smokey aroma, returning in taste. Bitterness growing at the end, smokey remains. Very nice beer. (Velp 201512)

On tap at Samo Pivo pub in Belgrade-Serbia. Pours clear amber caramel color, little foam. Nose: meh, a bit buttery, tons of cara in the finish. Mouth: sweet dyacetil like drink, a bit buttery. Not my cup of tea, really. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Caña en el Lupulo 20..12..2015. (r98). Color ámbar cobrizo oscuro con espuma beige, poca y que desaparece casi por completo. Aromas y sabores bastante ahumados con toques dulces de caramelos ligeramente quemados. Cereales rústicos, amargo pequeño al final. Cuerpo ligero a medio 5.4 vol fácil de beber. No está mal, buen ahumado.

Cask conditioned at The University Club, Oxford. Hazy amber with off white head. Talk about smoked, this is wet peat, damp ashes and charcoaled wood all in one. Heavy palate, some wheat ale notes with a squidgy banana hint. Very unusual.
On tap. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 10/12/2015 Color olor ámbar, sabor dulce, toques ahumados, cuerpo medio, bien.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours a slightly hazy amber with a thin layer of off white frothy. The aroma is fruity and smoky. Some orange and yeast too. The taste has light spice, citrus and rye before a surprisingly smokey finish. Th body is thin and it feels a little watery, but otherwise quite tasty and a bit different.

500ml bottle. Mid amber shade. Short head. Really great aroma. Big smoke conjuring up campfires. The rye is evident too. Taste is initially sweet, smoky, juicy berry fruity, orangey, some dryness. The smoky character is less here. Interesting stuff.

Draft 0.33l at Samo Pivo Belgrade Serbia.21.10.2015.Pour it hazy red color with small white head.Aroma of sour grapes.Taste of red fruits, some pinch of sour note, smoked on the back.Really nice balanced.

Bottle @home. Pours amber with a slight red tinge. Nose is smoked meat, smoke, tobacco, smoke, smoked fish, fish in general, gin/juniper. Taste is so much better than the nose, slightly sweet caramel, smoked eel.

Bottle from Oddbins West Hampstead. Deep reddish brown colour, nice white foam. Lots of smoke on the nose, sitting somewhere between kippers and kabanos on the aroma scale. Very smokey. Taste is interesting, again smoke quite dominant, some sweetish malt, spiciness, lots of smoke. Id say a well made smoked beer, just not sure when Id actually want to drink something this smokey.

33cl from trade with Douberd, many thank! (As Unforgiven Red Rye) Pours hazy reddish brown colour with a small beige head. Aroma of smoked malt, dark malt, bacon. Taste is mild smoky, bacon, red malt, tobacco, nice stuff!

33cl bottle at home from Kaapse Brouwers, Rotterdam. Body is opalescent copper amber, head is very small, off-white, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Nose is smoky, flavor is light smoke, bread, cracker, malty, light roasted peanuts, light dried fruits. Light sweet, light bitter, medium umami. Finish is long lasting medium bitter-umami, light salty. Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Quite easy, very interesting, great one.

Aroma: smokey, bacon, savoury, fruity. Appearance: clear amber, small, creamy, white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets continue, bread malts, caramel, red berries, sweet finish, soft carbonation, remains very smokey throughout. Overall: nice, smokey flavours, a touch sweet, but my first rate in this style category. Bottle from Oddbins, Pimlico.

0,33l fles bij berts Bierhuis vandaan dacht ik. Vol robijnrood met een bescheiden fluweel achtig crème laagje schuim. Geur begint met gerookt vlees en tabak daarnaast ook wat tropisch fruit. Smaak redelijk zoet met een klein bittertje een zuurtje. Pruim en tabak, in de afdronk wordt het een tikkeltje ziltig. Body is wat dun, iets wrang mondgevoel

Brown color with a thin beige head with short duration. Aroma has notes of meat, light caramel and toasted malts. Flavor is smoky, slightly sweet, some caramel and light dry fruits. Mild smoky final with smooth mouthfeel.
Bottle. Hazy red brown with a thin foam. Smoky bacon crisps with hedgerow red berries and earthy notes. Medicinal with toffee malts and earthy, spicy aspects. Vegetable fat palate. Decent.

Bottle from de Molen Beershop, batch UNF02 BB 04 Jun 2016, large sample. Clear copper color with some small debris, medium head. Aroma of spicy wood, bit smoked, campfire, some caramel. Soft malty taste, bit sweet, slight sharp wood, touch of sourness, bit salty. Bit dry in the finish. Nice stuff.
33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark orange, red color. Thin white head. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. Flavour is smokey, spices, wood, light chocolate.

330ml bottle from Tempest. 
Thin off white head, gentle lacing. Clear copper body. Nose is smoky, meaty, woody. Flavour is smoky berries, wood, nutty finish. Good mouthfeel, light carbonation. One of the smokiest beers I've had.

Bottle, pours amber/red with an off white head. Aroma: campfire smoke, spices, red berries, wood. Taste: smokey, wood, caramel, red berries, tobacco, citrus, spices. Medium sweet, moderate light bitter, light-medium body, thin oily texture, soft carbonation. Lingering smoke and fruity bitter finish. Well balanced. Underwhelming at first, quite nice at second impression.

12th September 2015Very hazy amber beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry. Modest fine carbonation. Mild marmalade, thin. White smoke. Modest bitterness and tangy orange in the dry finish. Doesnt really flow for me but its okay. Earlier Rating: 6/1/2014 Total Score: 3.231st May 2014Hazy reddish amber beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is semi dry and crisp. Little dry cream in the malt. Plenty of woody smoke but it avoids being acrid. Traces of marmalade and plummy fruits underneath. Finishes dry. Smoky linger. Not bad.
Bottle. Red copper color. Aroma of smokey ham, caramel and amber malt. Taste of rye, smoked ham, caramelised malt, soft bitters and some coffee. I like it.
Bottle. Reddish amber color. Red fruit and smoke in the aroma and flavor. Smoked suasage, citrus, rye. Unusual flavors that come together well somehow. Nice.

(Tempest Unforgiven Red Rye) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into an english pint glass, ABV 5.4%
Deep red colour on the body, small and thin beige head that disappears straight away. 
Aroma has smoke, bacon, some red fruits too.
Slightly sweet taste at first, with caramel, some smoke, smoked meats but sublte, traces of red fruits, more notable on the finish.
Medium thin body with good carbonatio.
Nice and interesting beer.
Bottle from alesella a slightly hazy amber red beer aroma is smokey and woody some red fruits smokey malts spicy notes smokey sweet finish

Sahti / Gotlandsdricke / Koduõlu ???? who decides this. Smoked rye beer maybe. Seriously interesting for a British beer. Smooth enough to be a German Rauchbier despite the presumed lack of lagering, Says rye on the tasting notes so maybe that accounts for the sweetness. Try it.

Weinig geur, wat waterige alesmaak met een prettig aanwezige rooksmaak. Eigenlijk is de rooksmaak het enige wat dit bier bijzonder maakt. Het heeft weinig body en had wat meer krachtiger kunnen zijn. Tegenvaller.
Pours a deep red with a cappuccino foamy head. Aroma is of a peaty fire. Taste starts off with sweet malt that leads to a very smokey after taste. A pretty nice beer.

Bottle; pours cloudy amber with a tan head; smoky aroma with some malt and a hint of fruit; taste is smoky with caramel and malt with hints of fruits and wood; finish had a little bitterness and more smoke; first Sahti, not bad

Hazy copper colour, diminishing cream head. Smoky aroma, caramel, light brown sugar, light spicy. Light sweet flavour, rye bread, caramel, smoke. Light smoky finish, light sweet, bread. Nice.(From 33cL bottle @ home, Help Benzai to 10 sahti/gotlansdricke ticks tasting. As Unforgiven Red Rye. Thanks for sharing, Benzai!)

Bottle [from trade with GlasgowTAD] shared with Martinus @ Help Benzai to 10 Sahti/Gotlandsdricke/Koduõlu - ticks tasting. Hazy rusty orange to copper color, average sized white to off-white head that diminishes fairly quickly. Smell and taste malts, lightly smoke, a touch of berries (should be juniper berries then I guess..) and softly sweet-bitter in the finish. Decent body and carbonation. Not bad.

330ml bottle at home, 5.4%. Dark orange with a red hue, clear, lightly sparkling, initially foamy beige head doesnt endure. Aroma is smoked ham and cheese, yeast and bread, background seaweed. Body is medium, rounded, not much carbonation. Taste is BBQ sauce, touches of chocolate syrup, some metallic tang, earthy and starchy, Lapsang tea and white pepper in the finish. Decent smoked beer.
Draught. Hazy amber colour. Light smoky aroma and flavour, medium body, wood, caramel, fruity.

Pours cloudy copper with low white head. Aroma of caramel, bread, light orange and citrus. Taste is caramel and toffee sweet with a lightly boozy, medicinal finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.
Light smoke aroma, with the smoke influence coming through more in the taste, the juniper gives a clean finish. Tasty.

Brown bottle, vino wines, 330ml. Pours dark translucent amber with a thin white head subsiding average. Scent is full bodied rye and hickory notes. Taste is dense hickory and smoky flavors on a light, bubbly palette. Excellent.
Sample at Great Grogs bottled beer festival. Aroma is smoke, juniper, sweet malts. Taste is a bit disappointment after aroma, sweet malts, light juniper.

Clear amber body with a medium beige head. Aroma is malty, light smokey, a bit fruity, a bit more smoke. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, light bitterness. Full body, dry finish. Not a big fan of smoked beers but this was quite enjoyable.
Cask at the Cobbles Inn, Kelso. Pours amber with off-white head. Smoke in aroma and flavor. Caramel malts, wood and some fruit.

50cl bottle from HB&B, London. It pours a rich copper color with a medium tan head. Aroma is lightly sweet, lightly roasty, malty and woody and smokey. Taste is medium sweet and lightly roasty and bitter, with nice smokiness with notes of campfire, bacon and burnt wood. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, very nice balance and clean smokiness.

Aroma is heavy smoked mackerel. Head is almost non-existant. Taste is salty smoked fish, sweet lager maltiness and a mellow smooth finish which does not last long. This is an interesting style, very smokey and salty reminiscent of smoked fish. Goes well with smoked fish, unsurprisingly.
Bottle at home. Pours clear amber, nose is smoked sausage, caramel, taste is similar, fruity.

50cl, as Tempest Unforgiven, new exclusive Scottish brew Anno 2012, thx alot to Tad for the bonus!, complex brew, malty/woody/smoked and slightly floral/spicy, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, small head, nice brew

Subtle, clever, interesting. The smoke takes the lead but isnt overpowering. Then some malt sweetness, meatiness, peppery spice and hints of peaty malt whisky. Nice copper brown body, little head or lacing. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle shared thanks to sic1314. Pours clear amber brown with a small tan head. Aroma of smoke, wood, caramel, herbs and almost a peatiness. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Poured light amber with a small off white head. Aroma of rauched malt, dark fruit. Medium body, flavour is moderately sweet, medium smoked and lightly bitter. Well balanced.

50cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Sic1314.
No head. Lightly smoked aroma. Slightly hazy amber pour. Well balanced smokiness junipers and oak. Nicely done.
Quite a lot going on here in the glass. Copper coloured, long nose.Gentle and deep lingering smokiness reminiscent of the best of Schenkerla. Tempest never fails to impress.

500ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 21-09-2014.
BBD: 01-12-2014.
In short: subtle smoky spicy ale.
Pours hazy copper with some little white head. Moderate head retention, poor lacing. Smoky, wood, spicy aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is subtle smoky, some wood, spicy, some caramel, quite well balanced flavours. Enjoyable.
Bottle @ Midlands Tasting Aug 14, at Richies Hop Palace. Pours orange / amber, with smoked beechwood aroma. Taste is basically smoked bacon frazzles with some grain and bitter rye. Tasty.

Shared with five others at the Midland tasting on 23rd Aug 2014. Light amber body with a smell and taste of Walkers Smokey Bacon Crisps. Not a lot more to add really, apart from it being different and interesting.


Amber colour slight head. Aroma is smokey bacon burnt caramel. Taste is sweet cured bacon caramel malts medium body
Big thanks to Benh for sending this bottle down to me for the Midland Tasting Group. Copper beer with small head. Aroma of smokey bacon and grain. Taste is a little smoke and sweet malts. Good stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 500ml bottle. Pours dark caramel with a small head. Aroma is heavy bacon smoke and woody leather. Taste has fruity red berries to start. Light smoky bacon finish.
Bottle midlands tasting group thanks to benh. Amber colour slight head. Aroma is smokey bacon burnt caramel. Taste is sweet cured bacon caramel malts medium body. Good stuff.
Bottle at Midlands Tasting Group via BenH cheers; hazy light amber pour with a frothy off white head, aroma has leather and smoked bacon, taste had a hint of spice, bacon, caramel and some nuts.

Huge thanks to BenH for grabbing this and giving to me as party favor from Edinburgh tasting. Pours orange amber with small head. Nose is piggy smoke with some pine. Tastes of ham, pine, caramel, campfire, and some cake. Spring water palate. Not lots of juniper. This was a big goal of my week here since Im a style ticker and very happy that others were kind enough to assist

Bottle. BB 12/14. Pours a reddy amber with a slightly off white head. The smoke comes through pretty nicely in the aroma - its close to being too much but OK. Medium body, medium carbonation. Caramel, light rye, hint of lemon... Balance is off - too much smokiness. Not great.

Tap at Irreale. Smoke and hay aromatics, cloudy orange, offwhite lace. Wheatbierish entry. Fruity roast, marmite toast, light smoke, herbal and grassy background. Fresh moreish medium light body. Quite pleasant

Color caoba con espuma marfil. Aromas ahumados y azúcar moreno. Cuerpo bajo, incluso aguado, inicio dulce ligeramente tostado que se une a un ahumado equilibrado para acabar en un amargor seco moderado. Bien.
Amber body with a fair biscuit-coloured head. Aroma of smoke is pretty subtle. Taste quite saline, some sweetness and bitterness. Little carbonation. Finish slightly cloying and too sweet.

Bottle from Drinkmonger. Clear amber body with a thin off-white head that fades to nothing. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of honey-glazed ham, farmyard, advent calendar chocolate and smoked meat. Flavour of flat cider, caramel and ginger. The smoked flavours are quite subtle, which I like. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Pairs well with Cheesestrings (dont judge me).

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks kerenmk. Pours brown to orange hazy with a medium head, aroma of smoke, fruits, chocolate, roasted tones, nice, flavor of cocoa, chocolate, roasted, vanilla, delicate, medium bodied.

500ml bottle from Scottish Beer Shop. Clear dark orange-copper amber colour, foamy off-white beige head and aroma of smoke, malt, ham, bread. Taste is smokey roasted malt & rye, with meaty ham, caramel and bitter piney notes. Creamy mouth feel, medium bodied, soft carbonation and dry light bitter finish with some caramel & rye. Very drinkable.
Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Clear dark gold with white ring. Maple and faint hickory smoke. Sweet, smoky taste, a little cocoa. Full-bodied, smooth, hickory finish.

Tap at BD Shoreditch. Pours clear dark amber with a small and sticky beige head. Nose is light smoke, caramelised banana, coconut and grass. Taste is balanced smoke, vinous and toffee apple with mild spice right on the back end. Very balanced and quite easy drinking. Never had this style and no idea what it is but its a solid beer
At a tasting, thanks kerenmk, hazy deep orange colour, aroma of hay and smoke, strange smokey flavour with some graininess and soy, just a touch of alcohol coming through. Nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks kerenmk. Amber-colored. Aroma of malt, caramel, some smokiness and some strange fruitiness. Sweetish and malty flavor with some smokiness, caramel, nutty notes, a chocolate hint and a light spicy note. Medium-bodied.

On Keg at North, aroma is lightly smoky to start, Beautifully balanced with a great sticky rye malt and caramel flavour that I really like. Smoky meat & cheese flavours with sweet caramel and rye? On paper this sounds a bit weird but I though this went really well together.

Bottle at home from alesela
Hazy mid amber, offwhite head (i was somehow expecting a dark beer?), slightly metallic smokey aroma which dissipates on warming to give some spicey notes. Full bodied with high carbonation, smoke hit at first, spicey juniper and an underlying sticky citrus rye and some sweet oakiness in the finish. Really accomplished beer, should have drunk it sooner.

Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell - London. Thanks to Colin. Pours clear, honey-copper with a creamy, off-white head. Big cured ham aroma, some caramel, honey. Medium sweet flavor with loads of honey-cured ham, smoked meat, some dry bread. Medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Dry, smokey ham finish, some toasted caramel. Nice stuff.

Bottle share at CBC clerkenwell. THanks to Mr Bois. Aroma is smoked pine wood, light medicinal tcp quality. Some twigs in there as well. Light amber colour with a light haze, thin white head. Flavour issmoke, peat, twigs, light berry notes. Some medicinal in the finish. Light tanic dryness in the finish as well.

Bottle shared at Craft Clerko, from The Highland Bottle shop in the Ness, 25/10/13.
Very lightly hazed golden amber with a good sized off white head.
Nose carries a big smokey punch, lap sang su chong tea leaves, light Frazzles, grainy, bready malt, spice.
Taste comprises smoked bacon, tea bags, nettles, more lap sang su chong notes, earthy, herbal, bread dough.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, dry finish with light smoke.
Decent enough smokey affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 500ml bottle at home. Pours clear amber with a good, long-lasting, white head. Aromas of woodsmoke, smoked meat, and a touch of caramel. Something spicy too. I believe the juniper has been dropped? And I think its the better for it, less confusion on the palate, and all about the smoke. Good.
Keg at Earl of Essex, Islington, London. An orange/amber coloured pour with a thin white head on top. Smokey, malty aroma. Tastes smokey, malty, fruity, slight sweetness. Really drinkable.

Keg at the Lyric, Soho. It pours hazy orange-amber with a small white head. The nose is smoke, earth, wood, spice and smoked cheese. The taste is smooth, smoke, nice bitterness, peppery, smoked cheese, touch of sweetness and wood with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. A well-balanced and rather drinkable smoked beer.
Bottle. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is smoked, malt, hop, caramel. Flavour is smoked, malt, hop, caramel, fruit. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

From the bottle. Pours deep copper brown. Aroma initially sweet and slightly resinous, smokey aromas develop over time. Starts very sweet with fruity malt and although spme astringency and sharpness increases towards the end this remaons very sweet throughout. Not unpleasant but too sweet.

Brilliant amber colored pour. Small off-white head that does not last more than a couple seconds. No lacing. Huge smoky aroma, with some hints of spicy rye.  Big malty flavor, with big traces of smoke. Some pepper hints. Nice malty aftertaste. Sweet and balanced.

Bottle. Dark amber white a white head. Aroma is smoke, wood with a little toffee. Flavour is big smoke with a sweet fruitiness. A messy combination of flavours but not unpleasant and strangely drinkable.
Cask by handpump at Blackfriars, Glasgow - clear brown ale, thin white head, smokey, light to medium body, good temperature, low carbonation, fruity

Bottle 500ml.Clear medium amber orange colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, smoke, wood, light meat - smoked meat. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, sweet smoked meat, caramel, light wood. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120623]
Bottle from Coppers in Newcastle. Red amber coloured with a slight sour, soapy red fruity flavour followed by vanilla and smoke on the finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ cloudy amber with a white head. Aroma of spicy malts, some grains, juniper and some smoked notes. Flavor is sweet smoke malt, some fruitiness and juniper with some spicy notes. Medium body,average carbonation.

Bottle 500ml @ fonefan
Pours slightly hazy deep orange with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, smoke, spices and juniper berries. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. A lightly unclear one, golden to amber in color and with a small, off-white head. Lighlty smoked nose with some caramel and a touch of dried fruits. Some sourish notes. The flavor has some smoke, as well as a piney, resiny bitterness and some sweet maltyness. Medium to full body. Not my preferred smoked beer, but sure drinkable. 120623
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Coloris amber. Aroma and taste are smoke, caramel, wood, juniper and hops.
Bottle, 5.4%. Hazy amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, smoke and a little meat. Flavour is malt, caramel, smoke, medium sweet, little meat, hop and a little bitter.

[bottle]
Bacony smoke aroma with maybe a little juniper--good balance between malt and smoke. Clear tawny gold under a bubbly, white island webbed by wisps. Woody dry flavour with dominant smoke followed by an assertive bitterness that fades to allow some malt backbone through. Faint fruity esters, but no apparent juniper. Medium body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitterness.

Bottle. Dark amber with decent white head. Aroma is a little strange, clear oak and smoke, some toffee and berry fruits. Taste is a slightly challenging mix of flavours, prominent oak and fair bit smoke, some tangy fruitiness. Slightly sweet and sticky with a bitter finish, doesnt clean well. Not sure this works but certainly interesting

Bottle at home. Dark orange/copper colour, bubbly off-white head fades with good lacing. Nice rich, smooth smokey nose, hint of rye spice, very very light juniper berry fruitiness also (though I dont imagine I would have got those flavours if I didnt know they were already there!). Hint of light floral hops also. Nice malty rye front with a subtle fish (kippers!) smoke underneath. Fruity juniper in the finish along with some nice rich (but not overly bitter) hop accents. This is phenomenally well-made, I would never have suspected that such unrelated flavours could marry together so effectively!

Appellation wines tasting, bottle 660 ml. Deep brown clear amber. Nose has lots of bread/rye, syrup. Taste is breadish, dryness from the juniper, some caramel sweetness. Long finish ends dry. Nice balance.

50cl bottle. Pours amber/orange with a thin layer of yeast. The nose has a smokey, tangy, orange toffee. The taste has ginger, smoke and then the juniper finish which is long and green.The palate is well balanced with a medium body, a good creamy texture and then a long tangy finish. Overall, interesting beer.

Fairly classic Rauchbier flavours on the nose and in the mouth. However, in terms of taste, the smoke is less oily and diminishes quickly with a nice sweet finish. Probably sacrilege but I find this more palatable and balanced than the Bamberg classics.

500ml bottle, Coppers, Ncl. Herbs, woodsmoke and dried meaty aromas, which are intriguing and combine well. Nice fizz on the palate, dry and bitter on the tongue with the berries kicking in in the finish. The dryness increases in the aftertaste, good rounded, interesting beer.

Air pressure cask at Euston Tap.  copper amber colour slight haze thin cream head. Yep definite smoke aroma. Smoked and got enough malt backbone to carry it. Quite a tough smoke. But it works here. Even some fishy smokiness. Really good. In fact i liked it hugely. Good smoke
Cask at HWBF. Amber with white head. An unusual brew. Nose is of smoked salmon. Juniper is definitly present. Well balanced sweetness. Very nice.

Cask @ Bacchus, Newcastle 230312
Copper brown...clear...thin white head
Aroma - spicy fruits...smoky...some barbecue sausage and juniper
Taste - Odd peppery fruity, smoky barbecue (not as much as a rauschbier), sweet caramel malt, woody smoke. background of bitter hops...Its a well made beer....I tried to like it and had 2 attempts on the same night...but I didnt
Palate - soft carb...thin to medium body...smooth...smoky aromatic palate. Finish dry smoky aromatic very longing.
Overall - I know its a well made beer...Interesting and unusual...but I  simply didnt like the taste....perhaps dont like junipers....I think this beer is meant to divide opinion

[cask at 27th HWFest, Riccarton] Amberish bronze beer with a pretty hefty head. Aromas mostly of smoke, with that juniper edge it did remind me of cured fish. Tastewise it was lovely - how Tempest get such a balance of flavour with ingredients such as that is beyond me. Touch of berry fruit at first on the taste, before the smoke arrived  but not to huge Bamburg level, it was pitched just right  before the finish flicked into sloe gin-esque juniper dryness. Didnt get a whole lot of rye, but the flavour was spot on   another winner [22032012]

On cask at The Heriot-Watt Beer Festival. Pours an amber colour with a thick beige head. Aroma is dominated by fishy smoke. Caramel and just a little juniper also coming through. A similar smoky flavour with mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Tasty.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2012 cask at herriot watt ... copper ... thin tan headn... light smoke ... hint of juinipr nose ... sweet nose ... very fruity ... juicy and light fishy mellow smokey 

cask at bow ... copper ... thin tan head ... meaty smoke ... soft toffee roast nose... dark malt ... light meaty roast ... quite fruit ... ok  but im not a smoke fan 3.6 fairly balanced

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2013 Cask @ The Jolly Judge, Edinburgh & 500ml bottle from Hippo Beers (?new recepie). Rich orange brown colour with a good head. Dry malty aroma. Smokey barbecue bacon flavour. Lingering dry smokey aftertaste. Unusual & interesting, bottle not as intense as cask.
